titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Parabel Project records
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hoover Institution Archives Staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-09-25T13:25-0700

change.item: Collection rehoused and rearranged by Frances Heldt.
Revised to update encoding and add unitid by Samira Bozorgi.
Revised to update encoding and add unitid by Elizabeth Phillips.
PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Parabel Project Records)//EN" "parabel.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

did.abstract: Writings, translations, notes, and questionnaire responses relating to a comparative study of underground movements in China, France, Italy, Kurdistan, and Poland, 1939-1947. Project sponsored by the Hoover Institution on War, Revolution and Peace and the Johns Hopkins University Operations Research Office.

origination.label: Contributor
origination.corpname: Johns Hopkins University. Operations Research Office.

origination.label: Contributor
origination.corpname: Hoover Institution on War, Revolution and Peace.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Parabel Project records, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1949.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Project undertaken by the Hoover Institution on War, Revolution and Peace in cooperation with the Operations Research Office, Johns Hopkins University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Writings, translations, notes, and questionnaire responses relating to a comparative study of underground movements in China, France, Italy, Kurdistan, and Poland, 1939-1947. Project sponsored by the Hoover Institution on War, Revolution and Peace and the Johns Hopkins University Operations Research Office.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes guerrilla operation worksheets and bibliographic cards.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Reports on Chinese Communist training and military terminology. Contains an historical study outline of the Parabel Project.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes annotated bibliographies titled, "The Chinese Red Army," "The Chinese Communist Guerilla Movement," and "Writings of Mao Tse-Tung."
